subject: p13031876
History: Alcoholic cirrhosis, in withdrawal, and encephalopathy, interval change.
Findings: One portable AP upright view of the chest. The right apical opacity is stable and concerning for either a nodule or infection. There are low lung volumes which exaggerates the bibasilar atelectasis. Anterior fusion hardware is seen. The cardiac, mediastinal and hilar contours are normal.
Impression: Right apical opacity concerning for either infection or nodule. Other than low lung volumes, no significant change compared to most recent study.
